description: From Latin pullorum, originally as part of a specific name Bacterium pullorum, now as the name of a serovar.

entries.meaning: (veterinary medicine) A severe infectious disease of young poultry, caused by a form of the salmonella bacterium. [from 20th c.]
examples: I should recount my own experience with chooks â€“ and I do not mean the difficulties, with lice, mites, fowl pox, pullorum or bum-drop about which subjects Goon's otherwise taciturn cousin gave me enough information to last a lifetime.
